newsitem.title: ARMENIA: World Bank to start talks on $60m loan for Armenia.
newsitem.headline: World Bank to start talks on $60m loan for Armenia.

text.p: Armenia will begin talks with the World Bank in June on a $60 million credit to help the former Soviet republic spur structural reforms and cover a budget deficit, the Economy Minister said on Friday.

Vagram Avanesyan told a news conference that representatives from the organisation had expressed satisfation with the country's credit policies and the general course of its transition from socialism to a market economy.
He said that a possible further three-year, $150 million World Bank credit package to Armenia would also be discussed.

Avanesyan said the $150 package would be on LIBOR concessional lending terms, with repayment to begin within three to five years, and that the funds would be used for macroeconomic stabilisation, social protection and the development of the private sector.
